title: Is it worth the time and money to earn an MFA in creative writing for a middle aged person? - Quora

response.answer_text: I only know one person who can truly answer that question for you, Steph.anie But here are some thoughts to present to that person: What would that person be looking for for the time and money invested in earning an MFA? Would it be for the MFA itself? That might be useful if you wanted, in middle age, to begin teaching. Would it be for the stimulation, practice and feedback involved in putting together an application, taking the courses, engaging with other students, and with teachers, and having people assign you challenging projects? That might be deeply rewarding. Expensive. Time consuming. But what else where you going to spend your life on?
Follow your passion. I got my BS degree when I was 59. I got my MBA in 2017 when I was 62. You’re investing your time, money and energy for a reason. Go for it!
